conclusion: Analyze the graph of the square of velocities versus displacement to determine which car has greater acceleration.
The graph shows v^2 on the y-axis and x on the x-axis.
Both cars start from the same position and move in the same direction with uniform acceleration.
For uniformly accelerated motion, the relationship between velocity squared and displacement is v^2 = u^2 + 2ax.
Both cars start from rest, so u = 0, simplifying the equation to v^2 = 2ax.
The graph is a straight line passing through the origin, indicating a linear relationship between v^2 and x.
The slope of the line represents 2a.
Car A has a steeper slope than Car B.
A steeper slope indicates a larger value of 2a, which means a larger acceleration a.
Since the slope of Car A's line is greater than that of Car B, Car A has a greater acceleration.
